comments: Starting (1, 2, 7, 38, 271,...) = A008292 * [1, 1, 2, 4, 8,...] [From _Gary W. Adamson_, Dec 25 2008]The inverse binomial transform is 1, 0, 1, 3, 19, 135, 1171, 11823, 136459,.. , see A091346. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2012
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
maple: A032109 := proc(n)    (A000670(n)+1)/2 ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 17 2012a := n -> (polylog(-n, 1/2)+`if`(n=0,3,2))/4:seq(round(evalf(a(n), 32)), n=0..18); # _Peter Luschny_, Nov 03 2015
